title: WHIRLING F2 / KLAASJE 1
description: A striking young woman in a silver body-suit smokes in the hostel hallway. She addresses you as if you were a police officer. You may use your finger pistols for a SUGGESTION red-check. Failure gives you some forewarning about what's going on.

dialogueTree.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Officer." The woman nods to you, s..."
dialogueTree.english: "Officer." The woman nods to you, still smoking her cigarette.
dialogueTree.polish: „Halo, panie mundurowy” – kobieta kiwa do ciebie, paląc nadal papierosa.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Інспектар", — жанчына ківае табе, працягваючы паліць цыгарэту.

links.title: You: ""Ah yes, *officer*... about that.""
links.english: "Ah yes, *officer*... about that."
links.polish: „A, tak, »mundurowy« – właśnie”.
links.belarusian: "А, так, *інспектар*... наконт гэтага."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes, sir?""
links.english: "Yes, sir?"
links.polish: „Tak?”
links.belarusian: "Так, спадару?"

links.title: You: ""How did you know I'm with the poli..."
links.english: "How did you know I'm with the police?"
links.polish: „Skąd wiedziałaś, że jestem z policji?”
links.belarusian: "Як вы даведаліся, што я з паліцыі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Unless you've been feeding us a se..."
links.english: "Unless you've been feeding us a set of well rehearsed lies, you've been here for three days. On *official police business* no less."
links.polish: „O ile nie karmił nas pan starannie przygotowanymi kłamstwami, jest pan tu od trzech dni. *W sprawach służbowych* bez wątpienia”.
links.belarusian: "Калі толькі вы не кармілі нас старанна падрыхтаванай хлуснёй, вы тут ужо тры дні. *Па службовых справах* без сумневу."

links.title: You: ""And what business is that?""
links.english: "And what business is that?"
links.polish: „I co to niby za sprawy?”
links.belarusian: "І што гэта за справы?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I couldn't say. In truth... so far..."
links.english: "I couldn't say. In truth... so far, mostly drinking."
links.polish: „Trudno powiedzieć. Ale tak szczerze... chyba głównie picie”.
links.belarusian: "Цяжка сказаць. Але калі шчыра... пакуль галоўным чынам піццё."

links.title: Logic: "You have no doubt about the drinkin..."
links.english: You have no doubt about the drinking, but do you strike yourself as a tight-lipped drunk? She must have heard *something*.
links.polish: Co do picia nie masz wątpliwości, ale chyba raczej nie wydajesz się milczącym opojem? Musiała *coś* słyszeć.
links.belarusian: Ты не сумняваешся наконт піцця, але хіба ж ты ціхі п'яніца? Яна павінна была *штосьці* пачуць.

links.title: You: ""I might not know where I am. Or wh..."
links.english: "I might not know where I am. Or who I am. Or what a *Coupris Kineema* is; how I know what one sounds like..."
links.polish: „Możliwe, że nie wiem, gdzie jestem. Ani kim jestem. Ani czym jest *coupris kineema*. I skąd wiem, jak one brzmią...”
links.belarusian: "Магчыма, я не ведаю, дзе я знаходжуся. Ці хто я такі. Ці што такое *Coupris Kineema*. І адкуль я ведаю, як яна гучыць..."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She nods."
links.english: She nods.
links.polish: Kiwa głową.
links.belarusian: Яна ківае.

links.title: You: ""...but I do know when someone's no..."
links.english: "...but I do know when someone's not telling me the whole story. What am I doing here? What's my case?"
links.polish: „...ale potrafię rozpoznać, kiedy ktoś nie mówi mi wszystkiego. Co ja tu *robię*? Jakie prowadzę śledztwo?”
links.belarusian: "...але я ведаю, калі нехта не расказвае мне ўсяго. Што я тут *раблю*? Што ў мяне за справа?»

links.title: You: ""That's it.""
links.english: "That's it."
links.polish: „To tyle”.
links.belarusian: "Вось і ўсё".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Good monologue!" She smiles, flash..."
links.english: "Good monologue!" She smiles, flashing her pearl-white teeth.
links.polish: „Dobry monolog!” – uśmiecha się, pokazując perłowobiałe zęby.
links.belarusian: "Добры маналог!" — яна ўсміхаецца, бліскаючы перламутрава-белымі зубамі.

links.title: You: ""I might not know who I am, but I d..."
links.english: "I might not know who I am, but I do know when someone's not telling me the whole story. What am I *doing* here?"
links.polish: „Może i nie wiem, kim jestem, ale potrafię rozpoznać, kiedy ktoś nie mówi mi wszystkiego. Co ja tu *robię*?”
links.belarusian: "Можа я і не ведаю, хто я, але ведаю, калі нехта не расказвае мне ўсяго. Што я тут *раблю*?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""There's a mercenary out back. He's..."
links.english: "There's a mercenary out back. He's been hanged. The body has been there for a week now. The locals probably got tired of it and called the cops."
links.polish: „Na tyłach są zwłoki najemnika. Wisi tam już od tygodnia. Miejscowym zaczęło to pewnie przeszkadzać i wezwali gliny”.
links.belarusian: "Там знадворку наёмнік. Яго павесілі. Цела там там ужо тыдзень. Тутэйшыя, напэўна, стаміліся ад яго і выклікалі паліцыю."

links.title: Empathy: "She speaks matter-of-factly, but th..."
links.english: She speaks matter-of-factly, but there's a sadness in her voice.
links.polish: Mówi rzeczowym tonem, lecz w jej głosie pobrzmiewa smutek.
links.belarusian: Яна гаворыць абыякава, але ў яе голасе чуваць смутак.

links.title: You: ""And why didn't you just tell me th..."
links.english: "And why didn't you just tell me that?"
links.polish: „I czemu mi tego po prostu nie powiedziałaś?”
links.belarusian: "І чаму вы мне гэтага проста не расказалі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I didn't mean to overwhelm you wit..."
links.english: "I didn't mean to overwhelm you with information. You seem a bit... lost, officer."
links.polish: „Nie chciałam przytłoczyć pana informacjami. Wydaje się pan trochę... zagubiony”.
links.belarusian: "Я не хацела перагружаць вас інфармацыяй. Вы здаяцеся крыху... разгубленым, інспектару."

links.title: You: ""Why don't I remember being a cop,..."
links.english: "Why don't I remember being a cop, or anything else?"
links.polish: „Czemu nie pamiętam, że jestem policjantem? Ani niczego innego?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму я не памятаю, што я коп, ці яшчэ чаго-кольвек?"

Alternate1.english: "I don't really remember being a cop, or anything else for that matter."
Alternate1.polish: „Nie pamiętam za bardzo, że jestem policjantem, ani niczego innego zresztą”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Я насамрэч не памятаю, што я коп, ды і нічога іншага пра гэта."

Alternate2.english: "I don't really remember being a cop, or anything else for that matter."
Alternate2.polish: „Nie pamiętam za bardzo, że jestem policjantem, ani niczego innego zresztą”.
Alternate2.belarusian: "Я насамрэч не памятаю, што я коп, ды і нічога іншага пра гэта."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I can see that.""
links.english: "I can see that."
links.polish: „Widzę”.
links.belarusian: "Я заўважыла."

links.title: You: ""Do you know why?""
links.english: "Do you know why?"
links.polish: „Wiesz dlaczego?”
links.belarusian: "Вы ведаеце, чаму?"

links.title: You: ""Good.""
links.english: "Good."
links.polish: „To dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Добра."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Is it?" She raises an eyebrow. The..."
links.english: "Is it?" She raises an eyebrow. The cigarette sizzles.
links.polish: „Naprawdę?” – unosi brew. Papieros skwierczy.
links.belarusian: "Сапраўды?" — яна ўскідвае брыво. Цыгарэта шыпіць.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Could it be because of the drinkin..."
links.english: "Could it be because of the drinking?" She raises an eyebrow. The cigarette sizzles.
links.polish: „Czyżby z powodu picia?” – unosi brew. Papieros skwierczy w jej ustach.
links.belarusian: "Ці можа гэта быць праз п’янства?" — яна ўскідвае брыво. Цыгарэта шыпіць.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "She hasn't had time to put her make..."
links.english: She hasn't had time to put her make-up on -- this is her morning cigarette. She looks tired, her beauty waning faster than it ought to at her age.
links.polish: Nie miała czasu na nałożenie makijażu – to jej poranny papieros. Wygląda na zmęczoną; jej piękno gaśnie szybciej niż powinno, biorąc pod uwagę jej wiek.
links.belarusian: У яе не было часу нафарбавацца — гэта яе ранішняя цыгарэта. Яна выглядае стомленай, яе прыгажосць згасае хутчэй, чым належыць у яе ўзросце.

links.title: You: ""Who in their right mind would let..."
links.english: "Who in their right mind would let *me* be an officer of the law?"
links.polish: „Kto zdrowy na umyśle pozwoliłby *mnie* być stróżem prawa?”
links.belarusian: "Хто ў здаровым розуме дазволіў бы *мне* быць праваахоўнікам?"

Alternate1.english: "Why would anyone let *me* be an officer of the law?"
Alternate1.polish: „Czemu ktokolwiek miałby pozwalać *mnie* być stróżem prawa?”
Alternate1.belarusian: "З чаго нехта дазволіў бы *мне* быць праваахоўнікам?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Don't be so harsh on yourself. The..."
links.english: "Don't be so harsh on yourself. They let almost anyone be a police officer."
links.polish: „Przesadza pan z tą samokrytyką. Do policji przyjmują każdego jak leci”.
links.belarusian: "Не будзьце да сябе такім суровым. У паліцыю бяруць амаль каго заўгодна."

links.title: Authority: "A glib remark. Don't let it stand -..."
links.english: A glib remark. Don't let it stand -- assert yourself.
links.polish: Rezolutny komentarz. Nie puszczaj go płazem, postaw się.
links.belarusian: Кплівая заўвага. Не пакідай яе без увагі — заяві пра сябе.

links.title: You: ""Actually, I can see why they would..."
links.english: "Actually, I can see why they would entrust me with the law. I have the right character."
links.polish: „W sumie to rozumiem, czemu zrobili ze mnie stróża prawa. Mam odpowiedni charakter”.
links.belarusian: "Папраўдзе я разумею, чаму мне даверылі закон. У мяне адпаведны характар."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""A fondness for contradictory state..."
links.english: "A fondness for contradictory statements?"
links.polish: „Skłonność do sprzeczności?”
links.belarusian: "Схільнасць да супярэчных заяваў?"

links.title: You: ""No. In the course of our conversat..."
links.english: "No. In the course of our conversation I have masterfully suppressed the urge to throw up. This is a sign of professionalism."
links.polish: „Nie. W trakcie naszej rozmowy po mistrzowsku powściągnąłem potrzebę zwymiotowania. To dowód na mój profesjonalizm”.
links.belarusian: "Не. Падчас нашай размовы я майстэрскі стрымліваў позыў на ваніты. Гэта прыкмета прафесіяналізму."

Alternate1.english: "No. In the course of our brief conversation I have masterfully suppressed the urge to throw up. This is a sign of professionalism."
Alternate1.polish: „Nie. W trakcie naszej krótkiej rozmowy po mistrzowsku powściągnąłem potrzebę zwymiotowania. To dowód na mój profesjonalizm”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Не. Падчас нашай кароткай размовы я майстэрскі стрымліваў позыў на ваніты. Гэта прыкмета прафесіяналізму."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Thank you, sir." She smiles, lazil..."
links.english: "Thank you, sir." She smiles, lazily. "I mean that."
links.polish: „Dziękuję” – uśmiecha się bez przekonania. „Szczerze”.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй", — яна лянотна ўсміхаецца. — "Шчыры."

links.title: You: ""No. I realized you were withholdin..."
links.english: "No. I realized you were withholding information. Something lit up in me. A killer instinct."
links.polish: „Nie. Zdałem sobie sprawę, że nie mówisz mi wszystkiego. Coś się we mnie obudziło. Instynkt zabójcy”.
links.belarusian: "Не. Я зразумеў, што вы прыхоўваеце інфармацыю. Нешта ўва мне запалілася. Інстынкт забойцы."

Alternate1.english: "No. I realized you were withholding information. Something lit up in me. A killer instinct."
Alternate1.polish: „Nie. Zdałem sobie sprawę, że nie mówisz mi wszystkiego. Coś się we mnie obudziło. Instynkt zabójcy”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Не. Я зразумеў, што вы прыхоўваеце інфармацыю. Нешта ўва мне запалілася. Інстынкт забойцы."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Of course." She pulls on her cigar..."
links.english: "Of course." She pulls on her cigarette.
links.polish: „Oczywiście” – zaciąga się dymem.
links.belarusian: "Натуральна" — яна зацягваецца цыгарэтай.

links.title: Rhetoric: "She remains unconvinced..."
links.english: She remains unconvinced...
links.polish: Wciąż jeszcze nie dała się przekonać...
links.belarusian: Яна ўсё яшчэ не перакананая...

links.title: You: ""No. I think I saw a sadness in you..."
links.english: "No. I think I saw a sadness in you when you told me about the hanged man. Others would have missed it."
links.polish: „Nie. Chyba ujrzałem w tobie smutek, kiedy powiedziałaś mi o wisielcu. Inni by go nie dostrzegli”.
links.belarusian: "Не. Мяркую, я ўбачыў у вас смутак, калі вы сказалі мне пра павешанага. Іншыя бы яго не заўважылі."

Alternate1.english: "I think I saw a sadness in you, when you told me about the hanged man. Others would have missed it."
Alternate1.polish: „Chyba ujrzałem w tobie smutek, kiedy powiedziałaś mi o wisielcu. Inni by go nie dostrzegli”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Мяркую, я ўбачыў у вас смутак, калі вы сказалі мне пра павешанага. Іншыя бы яго не заўважылі."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""But I wasn't sad." She tilts her h..."
links.english: "But I wasn't sad." She tilts her head.
links.polish: „Ale ja nie byłam smutna” – przekrzywia głowę.
links.belarusian: "Але я не была сумная" — яна нахіляе галаву.

links.title: You: ""No. My mind keeps coming up with t..."
links.english: "No. My mind keeps coming up with titbits of information -- all sorts of facts, trivia. Gives me a detective-y vibe."
links.polish: „Nie. Mój umysł wciąż podsuwa mi jakieś strzępki informacji. Najróżniejsze fakty, ciekawostki. Jak u jakiegoś detektywa”.
links.belarusian: "Не. Мой розум працягвае падкідваць мне кавалкі інфармацыі: разнастайныя факты, дробныя цікавосткі. Я пачуваюся дэтэктывам."

Alternate1.english: "No, I get these titbits of information sometimes, little facts like trivia. Gives me a detective-y vibe."
Alternate1.polish: „Nie, czasem umysł podsuwa mi strzępki informacji, różne fakty, ciekawostki. Jak u jakiegoś detektywa”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Не, часам розум падкідвае мне кавалкі інфармацыі, дробныя факты, цікавосткі. Я пачуваюся дэтэктывам."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Of course." She pulls on her cigar..."
links.english: "Of course." She pulls on her cigarette.
links.polish: „Oczywiście” – zaciąga się dymem.
links.belarusian: "Натуральна" — яна зацягваецца цыгарэтай.

links.title: You: ""No. I *deduced* that I'd thrown my..."
links.english: "No. I *deduced* that I'd thrown my shoe out the window from the direction of the shards."
links.polish: „Nie. *Wydedukowałem*, że wyrzuciłem swój but przez okno, na podstawie ułożenia odłamków”.
links.belarusian: "Не. Я *вывеў*, што выкінуў свой чаравік праз акно, на падставе размяшчэння аскепкаў."

Alternate1.english: "No. I had thrown my shoe out of the window. I *deduced* this from the direction of the shards."
Alternate1.polish: „Nie. Wyrzuciłem swój but przez okno. *Wydedukowałem* to na podstawie ułożenia odłamków”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Не. Я выкінуў свой чаравік праз акно. Я гэта *вывеў* на падставе размяшчэння аскепкаў."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Extraordinary." She pulls on her c..."
links.english: "Extraordinary." She pulls on her cigarette and nods.
links.polish: „Imponujące” – zaciąga się dymem, kiwając z uznaniem głową.
links.belarusian: "Надзвычайна" — яна зацягваецца цыгарэтай і ківае.

links.title: Rhetoric: "She doesn't actually think it's all..."
links.english: She doesn't actually think it's all that extraordinary.
links.polish: Tak naprawdę nie uważa, żeby było to szczególnie niesamowite.
links.belarusian: Насамрэч яна не лічыць, што гэта так ужо надзвычайна.

links.title: You: ""This is your morning cigarette. I..."
links.english: "This is your morning cigarette. I deduced this from your lack of make-up. Also -- you *party*. A lot."
links.polish: „To twój poranny papieros. Tak wnoszę po twoim braku makijażu. Ponadto *imprezujesz*. Bardzo dużo”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта ваша ранішняя цыгарэта. Я вывеў гэта па адсутнасці макіяжу. Акрамя таго, вы *тусуецеся*. Вельмі шмат."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Not as much as you..." She pulls o..."
links.english: "Not as much as you..." She pulls on her cigarette. "I'm sorry, sir. I didn't mean to be glib. I'm sure you're very good at your job."
links.polish: „Do pana mi jeszcze daleko...” – raczy się dymem z papierosa. „Przepraszam, nie chciałam się wyzłośliwiać. Na pewno jest pan świetny w swoim fachu”.
links.belarusian: "Не так шмат, як вы..." — яна зацягваецца цыгарэтай. — "Прабачце, спадар. Я не збіралася з вас кпіць. Упэўнена, вы вельмі дасведчаны ў сваёй працы."

links.title: You: ""Never mind. It's more likely someo..."
links.english: "Never mind. It's more likely someone made a mistake somewhere..."
links.polish: „Nieważne. Bardziej prawdopodobne, że ktoś gdzieś popełnił błąd...”
links.belarusian: "Не мае значэння. Больш верагодна, што нехта недзе зрабіў памылку..."

Alternate1.english: "Yes, what you just said. I can't come up with anything."
Alternate1.polish: „Tak, tak jak powiedziałaś. Nic mi nie przychodzi do głowy”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "«Так, тое, што вы сказалі. Нічога не магу прыдумаць."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm sorry. I was being glib." She..."
links.english: "I'm sorry. I was being glib." She pulls on her cigarette. "I'm sure you're a great cop."
links.polish: „Przepraszam. Przekomarzam się” – wciąga dym. „Na pewno jest pan świetnym gliną”.
links.belarusian: "Прабачце. Я проста кпіла" — яна зацягваецца цыгарэтай. — "Упэўнена, што вы выдатны паліцыянт."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "No, she's not! Reassert yourself by..."
links.english: No, she's not! Reassert yourself by being *flirtatious*.
links.polish: To nieprawda! Popraw swoją sytuację *flirtem*.
links.belarusian: Не, яна не ўпэўнена! Заяві пра сябе зноў, *фліртуй*.

links.title: You: "Better let it go. Say nothing."
links.english: Better let it go. Say nothing.
links.polish: Lepiej odpuść. Nic nie mów.
links.belarusian: Лепш адступіся. Нічога не кажы.

links.title: Authority: "Retreat is not a winning tactic."
links.english: Retreat is not a winning tactic.
links.polish: Odwrót nie jest taktyką zwycięzców.
links.belarusian: Адступленне гэта не пераможная тактыка.

links.title: Authority: "That feels like a jab, but honestly..."
links.english: That feels like a jab, but honestly -- you deserve it. Plus, it would be *rude* to reprimand her.
links.polish: To było jak pstryczek w nos, ale, szczerze mówiąc – należało ci się. Poza tym karcić ją byłoby *niegrzecznie*.
links.belarusian: Гэта адчуваецца як пстрычка ў нос, але, шчыра кажучы, — табе так і трэба. Да таго ж, дакараць яе было бы *непрыстойна*.

links.title: You: "Try *The Expression* on her -- let..."

links.english: "I should get going now." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Powinienem już iść”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Мне трэба ісці." [Адысці.]

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Of course." She puts out her cigar..."
links.english: "Of course." She puts out her cigarette. "Be careful, officer. They don't like the police around here."
links.polish: „Oczywiście” – gasi papierosa. „Proszę uważać. Nie lubią tu policjantów”.
links.belarusian: "Вядома" — яна гасіць цыгарэту. — "Сцеражыцеся, інспектар. Тут не любяць паліцыянтаў."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Something stirs in you as she's abo..."
links.english: Something stirs in you as she's about to go. Must be that *killer instinct* again -- the need to ask *questions*. It's like you've said the words a million times before...
links.polish: Kiedy zbiera się do odejścia, coś się w tobie budzi. To musi być ten *instynkt zabójcy* – potrzeba *zadawania pytań*. Jakbyś mówił to już wcześniej milion razy...
links.belarusian: Калі яна збіраецца сыходзіць, нешта ў табе варушыцца. Гэта мусіць быць той *інстынкт забойцы* — патрэба *задаваць пытанні*. Як быццам ты казаў гэтыя словы ўжо мільён разоў...

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She looks back at you, a light glin..."
links.english: She looks back at you, a light glinting off her eyes.
links.polish: Spogląda na ciebie, a światło odbija się w jej oczach.
links.belarusian: Яна азіраецца на цябе, і святло адлюстроўваецца ў яе вачах.

links.title: You: "What if I don't want to ask questio..."
links.english: What if I don't want to ask questions?
links.polish: A jeśli nie chcę zadawać pytań?
links.belarusian: А што, калі я не хачу задаваць пытанні?

links.title: Reaction Speed: "You're a cop, Harry. It is *unnatur..."
links.english: You're a cop, Harry. It is *unnatural* of you not to want to ask questions.
links.polish: Jesteś gliną, Harry. Niechęć do zadawania pytań byłaby dla ciebie *nienaturalna*.
links.belarusian: Ты коп, Гары. Нежаданне задаваць пытанні для цябе *ненатуральнае*.

links.title: Volition: "You don't have to. No one is forcin..."
links.english: You don't have to. No one is forcing you to be a cop.
links.polish: Nie musisz tego robić. Nikt cię nie zmusza do bycia gliniarzem.
links.belarusian: Ты не абавязаны гэтага рабіць. Ніхто не прымушае цябе быць паліцыянтам.

links.title: You: ""Wait! I have some questions before..."
links.english: "Wait! I have some questions before you go."
links.polish: „Poczekaj! Mam kilka pytań, zanim pójdziesz”.
links.belarusian: "Пачакайце! У мяне ёсць некалькі пытанняў, перш чым вы пойдзеце."

links.title: You: "Let the moment pass."
links.english: Let the moment pass.
links.polish: Pozwól tej chwili minąć.
links.belarusian: Не затрымлівацца на гэтым.

links.title: You: ""Before you go I have some *questio..."
links.english: "Before you go I have some *questions* for you."
links.polish: „Zanim pójdziesz, mam do ciebie kilka *pytań*”.
links.belarusian: "Перш чым вы пойдзеце, у мяне да вас некалькі *пытанняў*."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes?""
links.english: "Yes?"
links.polish: „Tak?”
links.belarusian: "Так?"

links.title: You: ""What is it that they have against..."
links.english: "What is it that they have against the police here?"
links.polish: „Co mają tutaj przeciwko policji?”
links.belarusian: "Што тут маюць супраць паліцыі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""The dockworkers are pretty cocky...."
links.english: "The dockworkers are pretty cocky. They think they're police enough. At least here on the coast -- I can't say about the rest of the city."
links.polish: „Pracownicy portowi mają się za chojraków, którym policja niepotrzebna. Przynajmniej tutaj, na wybrzeżu. Nie wiem, jak w innych częściach miasta”.
links.belarusian: "Працаўнікі порта даволі самаўпэўненыя. Яны лічаць, што яны і самі не горш за паліцыю. Прынамсі тут, на ўзбярэжжы. Не ведаю, як у іншых частках горада."

links.title: You: ""What is this place? Where am I?""
links.english: "What is this place? Where am I?"
links.polish: „Co to za miejsce? Gdzie ja jestem?”
links.belarusian: "Што гэта за месца? Дзе я знаходжуся?"

Alternate1.polish: „Co to jest właściwie za *miejsce*? Gdzie ja jestem?”

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""You're in a hostel, sir.""
links.english: "You're in a hostel, sir."
links.polish: „Jest pan w hostelu”.
links.belarusian: "Вы ў хостэле, спадару."

links.title: You: ""No -- *where* are we? Where in the..."
links.english: "No -- *where* are we? Where in the world?"
links.polish: „Nie, nie – *gdzie* jesteśmy? W jakim miejscu świata?”
links.belarusian: "Не — *дзе* мы? У якім месцы свету?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""We are in Revachol.""
links.english: "We are in Revachol."
links.polish: „W Revacholu”.
links.belarusian: "У Рэвашолі."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Revachol is the disgraced former ca..."
links.english: Revachol is the disgraced former capital of the world, divided into zones of control under foreign occupation -- half a century after a failed world revolution. She is central to our moment in time.
links.polish: Revachol to upadła, dawna stolica świata podzielona na strefy kontroli okupowane przez obce siły. Minęło pół wieku od nieudanej światowej rewolucji. To miejsce kluczowe dla naszej obecnej chwili.
links.belarusian: Рэвашоль — гэта зняслаўленая былая сталіца свету, падзеленая на зоны кантролю пад замежнай акупацыяй — на працягу паўстагоддзя з моманту няўдалай сусветнай рэвалюцыі. Гэта месца ключавое для нашага сённяшняга часу.

links.title: You: ""Should that mean something to me?""
links.english: "Should that mean something to me?"
links.polish: „To powinno coś dla mnie znaczyć?”
links.belarusian: "Гэта павінна нешта для мяне значыць?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""You sure look like you're from Rev..."
links.english: "You sure look like you're from Revachol. Revachol parties."
links.polish: „Wyglądasz na kogoś z Revacholu. Z revacholskich imprez”.
links.belarusian: "Вы дакладна выглядаеце, быццам вы з Рэвашолю. З рэвашольскіх вечарынаў."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Her accent suggests she is not from..."
links.english: Her accent suggests she is not from around here. She's from Oranje, another part of the world.
links.polish: Jej akcent wskazuje, że nie jest stąd. Przybyła z Oranje, innej części świata.
links.belarusian: Судзячы па яе акцэнце, яна не адсюль. Яна з Аранье, з іншай часткі свету.

links.title: You: ""Revachol forever.""
links.english: "Revachol forever."
links.polish: „Revachol na wieki”.
links.belarusian: "Рэвашоль навекі."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""For ever and ever.""
links.english: "For ever and ever."
links.polish: „Na wieki”.
links.belarusian: "На векі вечныя."

links.title: Shivers: "And ever and ever... Out of the cor..."
links.english: And ever and ever... Out of the corner of your eye, you see the hair on the back of your hand standing on end. It feels as though low-grade lightning is coursing through you. You must be hypersensitive from the hangover.
links.polish: Na wieki wieków... Kątem oka dostrzegasz, że włosy na wierzchu dłoni stają ci dęba. Jakby przebiegła przez ciebie błyskawica o niskim napięciu. To chyba spowodowana kacem nadwrażliwość.
links.belarusian: І да веку вякоў... Краем вока ты заўважаеш, што валасы на тыльным баку тваёй рукі сталі дыбарам. Падаецца, быццам слабы ток прабягае праз тваё цела. Ты, здаецца, зрабіўся гіперадчувальным праз пахмелле.

links.title: You: ""How about you tell me something el..."
links.english: "How about you tell me something else instead?"
links.polish: „A możesz mi powiedzieć coś jeszcze?”
links.belarusian: "Можа лепш раскажаце мне пра нешта іншае?"

links.title: You: ""Tell me what year it is.""
links.english: "Tell me what year it is."
links.polish: „Powiedz mi, który mamy rok”.
links.belarusian: "Скажыце, які цяпер год."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""It's '51.""
links.polish: „Pięćdziesiąty pierwszy”.
links.belarusian: "Пяцьдзясят першы."

links.title: You: ""What century?""
links.english: "What century?"
links.polish: „Którego stulecia?”
links.belarusian: "Якога стагоддзя?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""The Current Century.""
links.english: "The Current Century."
links.polish: „Bieżącego”.
links.belarusian: "Бягучага Стагоддзя."

links.title: You: ""And that's what? What number?""
links.english: "And that's what? What number?"
links.polish: „A które to? Jaki ma numer?”
links.belarusian: "Якое гэта? Які ў яго нумар?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Centuries don't have numbers, they..."
links.english: "Centuries don't have numbers, they have names, and this is the current one."
links.polish: „Stulecia nie są numerowane. Mają nazwy, a to jest bieżące”.
links.belarusian: " У стагоддзяў няма нумароў, яны маюць назвы, і гэта цяперашняя".

links.title: You: ""How many centuries have there been..."
links.english: "How many centuries have there been, then?"
links.polish: „Ile w takim razie było już stuleci?”
links.belarusian: "Тады колькі ж было стагоддзяў?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Civilization has existed for eight..."
links.english: "Civilization has existed for eight thousand years, sir." She grins.
links.polish: „Cywilizacja istnieje od ośmiu tysięcy lat” – uśmiecha się szeroko.
links.belarusian: "Цывілізацыя існуе вось ужо восем тысяч гадоў, спадару" — яна ўсміхаецца.

links.title: You: ""What's so funny?""
links.english: "What's so funny?"
links.polish: „Co w tym takiego zabawnego?”
links.belarusian: "Што такога смешнага?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""You're right." Her expression turn..."
links.english: "You're right." Her expression turns serious. "There is nothing funny about civilization."
links.polish: „Racja” – poważnieje. „W cywilizacji nie ma nic zabawnego”.
links.belarusian: "Вы маеце рацыю" — выраз яе твару робіцца сур'ёзным. — "У цывілізацыі няма нічога смешнага."

links.title: Empathy: "She hates civilization. She feels b..."
links.english: She hates civilization. She feels betrayed by it.
links.polish: Nie znosi cywilizacji. Czuje się przez nią zdradzona.
links.belarusian: Яна ненавідзіць цывілізацыю. Адчувае сябе здраджанай праз яе.

links.title: You: ""Okay, tell me something else.""
links.english: "Okay, tell me something else."
links.polish: „Dobrze, powiedz mi coś jeszcze”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, раскажыце мне пра нешта іншае."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yeah?""
links.english: "Yeah?"
links.polish: „Tak?”
links.belarusian: "Так?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "Those words -- "tell me something e..."
links.english: Those words -- "tell me something else" -- feel like something you've said innumerable times before. Your mouth is the very shape of them.
links.polish: Te słowa – „powiedz mi coś jeszcze” – sprawiają wrażenie wypowiedzianych już niezliczoną liczbę razy. Twoje usta nieomal zastygły w ich kształcie.
links.belarusian: Гэтыя словы — "раскажыце мне пра нешта іншае" — падаюцца нечым, што ты казаў ўжо незлічоную колькасць разоў. Твае вусны маюць іх форму.

links.title: You: ""Your room is almost next to mine...."
links.english: "Your room is almost next to mine. Did you hear anything last night?"
links.polish: „Twój pokój jest bardzo blisko mojego. Słyszałaś może coś w nocy?”
links.belarusian: "Ваш пакой амаль суседні з маім. Вы што-небудзь чулі мінулай ноччу?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""There was the usual ruckus." She s..."
links.english: "There was the usual ruckus." She shrugs. "Loud disco music."
links.polish: „Było typowe zamieszanie” – wzrusza ramionami. „Głośna muzyka disco”.
links.belarusian: "Быў звычайны вэрхал", — яна паціскае плячыма. — "Гучная музыка дыска."

links.title: You: ""Did I have any visitors?""
links.english: "Did I have any visitors?"
links.polish: „Miałem jakichś gości?”
links.belarusian: "Мяне хтосьці наведваў?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I couldn't say -- it's impossible..."
links.english: "I couldn't say -- it's impossible to hear people speaking from over here." She nods toward Room #3.
links.polish: „Trudno powiedzieć – stąd nie da się usłyszeć rozmawiających osób” – wskazuje gestem pokój numer 3.
links.belarusian: "Не магу сказаць — адсюль нельга пачуць, як размаўляюць людзі" — яна ківае галавой на пакой нумар 3.

links.title: You: ""Loud disco music?""
links.english: "Loud disco music?"
links.polish: „Głośna muzyka disco?”
links.belarusian: "Гучная музыка дыска?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Oh yes, various artists. Ostentati..."
links.english: "Oh yes, various artists. Ostentatious Orchestrations prime among them." She raises an eyebrow, waiting for the name to connect with you.
links.polish: „O tak, różni wykonawcy, głównie Orkiestra Ostentacji” – unosi brew, czekając, aż ta nazwa dotrze do banku twojej wiedzy muzycznej.
links.belarusian: "О, так, розныя выканаўцы. Пераважна Ostentatious Orchestration" — яна ўскідвае брыво, чакаючы, да цябе дойдзе гэтая назва.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Oh, *that*. Yeah, whooh... The less..."
links.english: Oh, *that*. Yeah, whooh... The less said about OO, the better.
links.polish: Ach, *oni*. Uch... Im mniej mówimy o OO, tym lepiej.
links.belarusian: Ах, *яны*. Так, фух... Чым менш сказана пра ОО, тым лепш.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""OO were *huge* where I come from...."
links.english: "OO were *huge* where I come from. I was very young then, of course. Like seven. 'Life gets haaard!'" she sings, "'But we go ooooooon!'"
links.polish: „Tam, skąd pochodzę, OO byli *wielkimi gwiazdami*. Miałam wtedy nie więcej niż siedem lat. »Życie jest truuuuuudne!«” – śpiewa. „»Lecz my trwamy daaaaaalej...«”
links.belarusian: "Там, адкуль я паходжу, OO былі *зоркамі*. Мне тады, вядома ж, было зусім мала гадоў. Хіба сем. Life gets haaard! — спявае яна. — But we go ooooooon!"

links.title: Rhetoric: "In that case, doesn't life get hard..."
links.english: In that case, doesn't life get hard *because* we go on?
links.polish: Czy w takim razie życie nie robi się trudne *dlatego*, że trwamy dalej?
links.belarusian: У такім выпадку, ці не робіцца жыццё складаным *праз тое*, што мы працягваем далей?

links.title: You: ""Yeah, we go on, alright.""
links.english: "Yeah, we go on, alright."
links.polish: „Tak, zdecydowanie trwamy dalej”.
links.belarusian: "Так, добра, працягваем далей."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I don't know about that... At arou..."
links.english: "I don't know about that... At around two o'clock, the disco stopped, and there was a change of pace."
links.polish: „No nie wiem... Mniej więcej o drugiej disco ucichło i klimat się zmienił”.
links.belarusian: "Ну, не ведаю... Прыкладна а другой гадзіне дыска сціхла, і атмасфера змянілася."

links.title: You: ""What happened?""
links.english: "What happened?"
links.polish: „Co się stało?”
links.belarusian: "Што здарылася?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""A slow, sad song started playing...."
links.english: "A slow, sad song started playing. Like organ music, on repeat. That went on for quite a while. Some of the time you were yelling along to it."
links.polish: „Zaczęła się wolna, smutna piosenka. Jakby organowa, na zapętleniu. Trochę to trwało. Chwilami wył pan w jej rytm”.
links.belarusian: "Пачала граць павольная, сумная песня. Як арганная музыка, на паўторы. Гэта цягнулася некаторы час. Час ад часу вы галасілі пад яе."

links.title: You: ""Was I singing this?" (Show her the..."
links.english: "Was I singing this?" (Show her the empty case of "The Smallest Church In Saint-Saëns".)
links.polish: „Śpiewałem to?” (Pokaż jej puste pudełko po „Najmniejszym kościele w Saint-Saëns”).
links.belarusian: "Ці я гэта спяваў?" (Паказаць ёй пустую скрынку ад "The Smallest Church In Saint-Saëns").

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes! There was a church in there...."
links.english: "Yes! There was a church in there. A really small church. Like the smallest, saddest church in the whole world. It was about that. And also..."
links.polish: „Tak! Był tam kościół. Taki bardzo mały. Najmniejszy i najsmutniejszy kościół świata. O tym to było. Ale też...”
links.belarusian: "Так! Там было пра царкву. Надта маленькую царкву. Найменшую і самую сумную царкву ў свеце. Там было пра гэта. І яшчэ...»

links.title: You: ""What else?""
links.english: "What else?"
links.polish: „Co jeszcze?”
links.belarusian: "Што яшчэ?"

links.title: You: ""What was I singing?""
links.english: "What was I singing?"
links.polish: „Co śpiewałem?”
links.belarusian: "Што я спяваў?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""That it doesn't *matter* anymore...."
links.english: "That it doesn't *matter* anymore. And that we're *alone* now. It was difficult to tell -- the song itself was very quiet and soft, but you sounded like a wounded boar, sir. It was hard to understand what you were singing on top of it."
links.polish: „Coś o tym, że nic już nie ma *znaczenia* i że zostaliśmy *sami*. Trudno stwierdzić – piosenka była bardzo cicha i spokojna, ale pan ryczał jak ranny łoś. Słowa ginęły w tym zawodzeniu”.
links.belarusian: "Што ўжо нічога не мае *значэння*. І што мы цяпер *адны*. Цяжка сказаць — песня была вельмі ціхая і спакойная, але вы гучалі як паранены дзік, спадару. Праз гэта складана было зразумець, што вы спяваеце."

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry.""
links.english: "I'm sorry."
links.polish: „Przepraszam”.
links.belarusian: "Прабачце."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Don't be, I was going out later an..."
links.english: "Don't be, I was going out later anyway. It didn't bother me."
links.polish: „Nie ma za co, i tak potem wyszłam. Nie przeszkadzało mi to”.
links.belarusian: "Няма за што, я ўсё роўна потым пайшла. Мяне гэта не турбавала."

links.title: You: ""When you say *wounded* do you mean..."
links.english: "When you say *wounded* do you mean that in a *cool* way? Like a *wild beast*?"
links.polish: „Ale *ranny* w takim *czadowym* sensie? Jak jakaś *dzika bestia*?”
links.belarusian: " Калі вы кажаце *паранены*, то маеце на ўвазе ў такім *крутым* сэнсе? Як *дзікі звер*?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes. It was very cool.""
links.english: "Yes. It was very cool."
links.polish: „Tak. Bardzo dzikie to było”.
links.belarusian: "Так. Гэта было вельмі крута."

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's impossible to say whether she'..."
links.english: It's impossible to say whether she's being sarcastic or really means it.
links.polish: Nie sposób stwierdzić, czy mówi to z sarkazmem, czy naprawdę tak myśli.
links.belarusian: Немагчыма зразумець, ці кажа яна гэта з сарказмам, ці сапраўды так лічыць.

links.title: You: ""Then what happened?""
links.english: "Then what happened?"
links.polish: „Co się potem stało?”
links.belarusian: "Што адбылося потым?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Then you started screaming and tra..."
links.english: "Then you started screaming and trashed the place."
links.polish: „Potem zaczął pan krzyczeć i wszystko zdemolował”.
links.belarusian: "Потым вы пачалі крычаць і разнеслі пакой."

links.title: You: ""Are you sure I wasn't being assaul..."
links.english: "Are you sure I wasn't being assaulted?"
links.polish: „Jesteś pewna, że nikt mnie nie zaatakował?”
links.belarusian: "Вы ўпэўнены, што ніхто на мяне не напаў?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""No, it didn't sound like there was..."
links.english: "No, it didn't sound like there was a fight. It sounded like someone was trashing their room."
links.polish: „Nie było odgłosów walki. Tylko demolowania pokoju”.
links.belarusian: "Не, гэта не гучала як бойка. Гучала так, быццам нехта разносіць свой пакой."

links.title: You: ""That's so *me*. What did I do?""
links.english: "That's so *me*. What did I do?"
links.polish: „To zupełnie w *moim stylu*. Co zrobiłem?”
links.belarusian: "Гэта цалкам у *маім стылі*. Што я зрабіў?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""A window was smashed. The tape pla..."
links.english: "A window was smashed. The tape player probably -- the song stopped -- and furniture too. A real destructothon. There was screaming. Then, I think, you passed out."
links.polish: „Okno nie przetrwało. I chyba magnetofon, bo piosenka nagle ucichła. No i pewnie meble. Piękny pokaz destrukcji. W akompaniamencie krzyków. Potem chyba stracił pan przytomność”.
links.belarusian: "Акно разбілася. Магнітафон, магчыма — песня спынілася — і мэбля таксама. Сапраўдная масакра. І былі крыкі. Потым, мяркую, вы страцілі прытомнасць."

links.title: You: ""Was there anything else?""
links.english: "Was there anything else?"
links.polish: „Działo się coś jeszcze?”
links.belarusian: "Ці было нешта яшчэ?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""There was. I think you screamed th..."
links.english: "There was. I think you screamed that you... didn't want to be 'this type of animal' anymore. I may have misheard, but it was sort of memorable."
links.polish: „Owszem. Wrzeszczał pan chyba, że... nie chce pan już być »takim zwierzęciem«. Może źle usłyszałam, ale to akurat zapadło mi w pamięć”.
links.belarusian: "Вядома ж. Вы, здаецца, крычалі, што... не хочаце больш быць "гэтай жывёлінай". Магчыма, я дрэнна пачула, але гэта было даволі запамінальна."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Sounds like you were in some real *..."
links.english: Sounds like you were in some real *fundamental* pain there, muscle-man.
links.polish: Zdaje się, że cierpiałeś jakiś *fundamentalny* ból, mięśniaku.
links.belarusian: Здаецца, ты пакутаваў ад нейкага *фундаментальнага* болю, мацачок.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I went out afterwards. Everything..."
links.english: "I went out afterwards. Everything was quiet by then. Around four or five." She nods. "And that was it."
links.polish: „Potem wyszłam. Do tego czasu wszystko już się uspokoiło. Około czwartej lub piątej” – kiwa głową. „I tyle”.
links.belarusian: "Пасля гэтага я пайшла. Тады ўжо было ціха. Каля чацвёртай або пятай" — яна ківае. — "Вось і ўсё."

links.title: You: ""Please tell me there wasn't anythi..."
links.english: "Please tell me there wasn't anything *else*."
links.polish: „Powiedz, proszę, że nie działo się *nic więcej*”.
links.belarusian: "Калі ласка, скажыце, што не было нічога *яшчэ*."

links.title: You: ""It prides me to hear this. Tell me..."
links.english: "It prides me to hear this. Tell me there was more."
links.polish: „Aż mnie duma rozpiera. Powiedz, że działo się coś jeszcze”.
links.belarusian: "Чуць такое — гэта гонар. Скажыце, што было штосьці яшчэ."

links.title: You: ""You're making this up. I would nev..."
links.english: "You're making this up. I would never behave like that."
links.polish: „Chyba zmyślasz. W życiu bym się tak nie zachował”.
links.belarusian: "Вы гэта прыдумляеце. Я б ніколі так не паводзіўся."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes." She looks at you. "Never.""
links.english: "Yes." She looks at you. "Never."
links.polish: „Prawda” – spogląda na ciebie. „W życiu”.
links.belarusian: "Так" — яна глядзіць на цябе. — "Ніколі."

links.title: You: ""What happened then?""
links.english: "What happened then?"
links.polish: „Co się stało potem?”
links.belarusian: "Што здарылася потым?"

links.title: You: ""I've heard enough.""
links.english: "I've heard enough."
links.polish: „Wiem już dosyć”.
links.belarusian: "Я пачуў дастаткова."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Okay.""
links.english: "Okay."
links.polish: „Okej”.
links.belarusian: "Добра."

links.title: You: ""It mostly just gets hard, doesn't..."
links.english: "It mostly just gets hard, doesn't it?"
links.polish: „Ale bardziej jednak robi się trudne niż trwamy, co?”
links.belarusian: "Звычайна проста робіцца складаней, так?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""It would appear so. At around two..."
links.english: "It would appear so. At around two o'clock, the disco stopped, and there was a change of pace."
links.polish: „Na to wygląda. Mniej więcej o drugiej disco ucichło i klimat się zmienił”.
links.belarusian: "Падобна на тое. Прыкладна а другой дыска сціхла, і атмасфера змянілася."

links.title: You: ""Maybe we should stop going on then..."
links.english: "Maybe we should stop going on then? Doesn't the 'going on' cause the 'getting harder' part?"
links.polish: „Może w takim razie powinniśmy przestać trwać? Czy to trwanie nie powoduje trudności?”
links.belarusian: "Можа, тады нам варта перастаць працягваць? Ці не праз гэтае працягванне робіцца складаней?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I think you might have come to the..."
links.english: "I think you might have come to the same conclusion last night. At around two o'clock, the disco stopped, and there was a change of pace."
links.polish: „Możliwe, że wczoraj doszedł pan do tego samego wniosku. Mniej więcej o drugiej disco ucichło i klimat się zmienił”.
links.belarusian: "Мяркую, што ўчора вы прыйшлі да той жа высновы. Прыкладна а другой дыска сціхла, і атмасфера змянілася."

links.title: You: ""Tell me something else.""
links.english: "Tell me something else."
links.polish: „Powiedz mi coś innego”.
links.belarusian: "Раскажыце мне пра нешта іншае."

links.title: You: ""Okay. You can go now." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Okay. You can go now." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Dobrze. Możesz już iść”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Добра. Цяпер можаце ісці." [Адысці.]

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Glad to have been of assistance.""
links.english: "Glad to have been of assistance."
links.polish: „Cieszę się, że mogłam pomóc”.
links.belarusian: "Рада, што змагла дапамагчы."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""And no, it never stops.""
links.english: "And no, it never stops."
links.polish: „I nie, nie kończy się”.
links.belarusian: "І не, гэта ніколі не скончваецца."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Goodbye.""
links.english: "Goodbye."
links.polish: „Do widzenia”.
links.belarusian: "Да пабачэння."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Something stirs in you as she's abo..."
links.english: Something stirs in you as she's about to go. Call it an instinct, a need -- the need to ask *questions*. It's like you've said the words a million times before...
links.polish: Kiedy zbiera się do odejścia, coś się w tobie budzi. Nazwij to instynktem, potrzebą... *zadawania pytań*. Jakbyś mówił to już wcześniej milion razy...
links.belarusian: Калі яна збіраецца сыходзіць, нешта ў табе варушыцца. Назаві гэта інстынктам, патрэбай — патрэбай задаваць *пытанні*. Як быццам ты казаў гэтыя словы ўжо мільён разоў...

links.title: You: ""*Officer*? Am I military personnel?""
links.english: "*Officer*? Am I military personnel?"
links.polish: „*Panie mundurowy*? Jestem wojskowym?”
links.belarusian: "*Інспектар*? Я супрацоўнік падатковай?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Uh... no." She seems perplexed by..."
links.english: "Uh... no." She seems perplexed by your question.
links.polish: „Ee... nie” – jej odpowiedź wyraża zakłopotanie.
links.belarusian: "Ээ... не" — яна здаецца збянтэжанай тваім пытаннем.

links.title: Authority: "There's only one solution to this...."
links.english: There's only one solution to this. You're a businessman.
links.polish: Odpowiedź może być tylko jedna: jesteś biznesmenem.
links.belarusian: Застаецца толькі адзін варыянт. Ты фінінспектар.

links.title: You: ""Wait, I know! I'm a businessman. *..."
links.english: "Wait, I know! I'm a businessman. *Chief executive officer*, right?"
links.polish: „Czekaj, wiem! Jestem biznesmenem. *Sprzedaję mundury*, prawda?”
links.belarusian: "Чакай, я ведаю! Я фінінспектар. *Галоўны фінансавы інспектар*, так?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "The young woman shakes her head slo..."
links.english: The young woman shakes her head slowly.
links.polish: Kobieta powoli kręci głową.
links.belarusian: Жанчына павольна круціць галавой.

links.title: Conceptualization: "*Officer* could be an artistic stat..."
links.english: *Officer* could be an artistic statement. You're already prone to those.
links.polish: *Mundurowy* może być też elementem artystycznego wyrazu. Masz już do takich rzeczy skłonność.
links.belarusian: *Інспектар* можа быць мастацкім выказваннем. Ты ўжо схільны да такіх рэчаў.

links.title: You: ""'Officer' is my stage name, right?..."
links.english: "'Officer' is my stage name, right? I can see myself as a middling disco artist called 'The Officer.'"
links.polish: „»Mundurowy« to moje imię sceniczne, prawda? Wyobrażam sobie siebie jako przeciętnego twórcę disco o pseudonimie Mundurowy”.
links.belarusian: ""Інспектар" — гэта маё сцэнічнае імя, так? Магу ўявіць сабе, што я звычайны выканаўца дыска з псеўданімам Інспектар."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""No..." She looks you in the eye. "..."
links.english: "No..." She looks you in the eye. "You're a *police* officer, sir."
links.polish: „Nie...” – patrzy ci prosto w oczy. „Jest pan *policjantem*, proszę pana”.
links.belarusian: "Не..." — яна глядзіць табе проста ў вочы. — "Вы *паліцыянт*, спадару."

links.title: You: ""Okay... Chief technical officer?""
links.english: "Okay... Chief technical officer?"
links.polish: „No dobrze. Projektantem mundurów?”
links.belarusian: "Ну добра. Пажарны інспектар?"

Alternate1.english: "That's too wild. Chief Technical Officer is what I am."
Alternate1.polish: „To już przesada. Jestem projektantem mundurów, ot co”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Гэта ўжо занадта. Я пажарны інспектар, вось і ўсё".

links.title: Conceptualization: "*Officer* could be an artistic stat..."
links.english: *Officer* could be an artistic statement. A claim to *official* renown.
links.polish: *Mundurowy* może być też elementem artystycznego wyrazu. Pretensją do *oficjalnej* sławy.
links.belarusian: *Інспектар* можа быць мастацкім выказваннем. Прэтэнзіяй на *афіцыйную* славу.

links.title: You: ""Then why did you call me an office..."
links.english: "Then why did you call me an officer?"
links.polish: „Więc czemu nazwałaś mnie mundurowym?”
links.belarusian: "Тады чаму вы назвалі мяне інспектарам?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Because you're a police officer, s..."
links.english: "Because you're a police officer, sir." She pulls on her cigarette.
links.polish: „Bo jest pan policjantem, proszę pana” – zaciąga się dymem.
links.belarusian: "Бо вы паліцыянт, спадару" — яна зацягваецца цыгарэтай.

links.title: You: ""Are you sure?""
links.english: "Are you sure?"
links.polish: „Jesteś pewna?”
links.belarusian: "Вы ўпэўнены?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I am, yes. Unless you've been feed..."
links.english: "I am, yes. Unless you've been feeding us a set of very well rehearsed lies all this time..." She takes another drag.
links.polish: „Tak, jestem. Chyba że przez cały ten czas karmił nas pan starannie przygotowanymi kłamstwami...” – wciąga jeszcze trochę dymu w płuca.
links.belarusian: "Так, упэўнена. Калі толькі ўвесь гэты час вы не кармілі нас старанна падрыхтаванай хлуснёй..." — яна робіць яшчэ адну зацяжку.

links.title: You: ""All this time?""
links.english: "All this time?"
links.polish: „Cały ten czas?”
links.belarusian: "Увесь гэты час?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""You've been here for three days. O..."
links.english: "You've been here for three days. On *official police business*, no less."
links.polish: „Jest pan tu od trzech dni. *W sprawach służbowych*, bez wątpienia”.
links.belarusian: "Вы тут ужо тры дні. *Па службовых справах* без сумневу."

links.title: You: ""You're shitting me!""
links.english: "You're shitting me!"
links.polish: „Jaja sobie ze mnie robisz!”
links.belarusian: "Ды вы мяне дурыце!"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm not. Unless *you've* been shit..."
links.english: "I'm not. Unless *you've* been shitting *us* all this time..." She takes another drag.
links.polish: „Taka jest prawda. Chyba że przez cały ten czas to *pan* z *nas* robił sobie jaja...” – wciąga jeszcze trochę dymu w płuca.
links.belarusian: "Не. Калі толькі *вы* не дурылі *нас* увесь гэты час..." — яна робіць яшчэ адну зацяжку.

links.title: You: ""God damn right, I'm a policeman! A..."
links.english: "God damn right, I'm a policeman! And don't you forget it!"
links.polish: „Jestem policjantem jak jasna cholera! I nie waż się o tym zapominać!”
links.belarusian: "Так, я паліцыянт, чорт яго бяры! І не забывайцеся пра гэта!"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Okay, cool. I won't.""
links.english: "Okay, cool. I won't."
links.polish: „Dobrze, spoko, będę pamiętać”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, дамова. Не забудуся."

links.title: Empathy: "She means it. She wouldn't defy aut..."
links.english: She means it. She wouldn't defy authority, however sweaty and bloated it may look.
links.polish: Mówi szczerze. Nie sprzeciwiłaby się władzy, nawet tak zapoconej i opuchniętej.
links.belarusian: Яна гаворыць шчыра. Яна не выступіла бы супраць улады, нават такой потнай і азызлай.

links.title: You: ""No need to be alarmed. I was just..."
links.english: "No need to be alarmed. I was just getting into character, you know."
links.polish: „Nie ma powodu do obaw. Wczuwałem się tylko w rolę, rozumiesz”.
links.belarusian: "Не варта хвалявацца. Я проста ўжываўся ў ролю, ведаеце."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Okay." She breathes in the silvery..."
links.english: "Okay." She breathes in the silvery smoke.
links.polish: „Okej” – wdycha dawkę srebrzystego dymu.
links.belarusian: "Добра" — яна ўдыхае срэбны дым.

links.title: Endurance: "Whoah! Something wants to come out..."
links.english: Whoah! Something wants to come out of you -- a bit of vomit? Thankfully you keep it down, because your body does not control you.
links.polish: O rany! Coś chce wyjść ci przez usta. Wymiociny? Szczęśliwie udaje ci się to powstrzymać, bo to ty kontrolujesz swoje ciało, a nie odwrotnie.
links.belarusian: Вой! Нешта хоча вырвацца з цябе навонкі — ваніты? На шчасце, ты даеш рады гэта стрымаць, бо гэта ты кантралюеш сваё цела, а не наадварот.

links.title: You: ""How did you know I'm a police offi..."
links.english: "How did you know I'm a police officer?"
links.polish: „Skąd wiedziałaś, że jestem funkcjonariuszem policji?”
links.belarusian: "Як вы даведаліся, што я супрацоўнік паліцыі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Sir, you've been here for three da..."
links.english: "Sir, you've been here for three days. On *official police business*, as you put it."
links.polish: „Jest pan tu od trzech dni. *W sprawach służbowych*, jak sam pan twierdził”.
links.belarusian: "Спадар, вы тут ужо тры дні. *Па службовых справах*, як вы самі сцвярджалі."

links.title: You: ""Good. Now, how did you know I was..."
links.english: "Good. Now, how did you know I was a police officer?"
links.polish: „Dobrze. Skąd wiedziałaś, że jestem policjantem?”
links.belarusian: "Добра. Дык як вы даведаліся, што я паліцыянт?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""First I have to ask: Are you okay,..."
links.english: "First I have to ask: Are you okay, sir?" All of a sudden, she looks genuinely concerned. "You look like you're about to throw up... Can I bring you something?"
links.polish: „Proszę najpierw powiedzieć, czy nic panu nie jest” – wydaje się autentycznie przejęta. „Wygląda pan tak, jakby miał zaraz zwymiotować... Może coś panu przynieść?”
links.belarusian: "Спачатку я мушу спытаць, ці ўсё з вамі ў парадку, спадару," — знянацку яна выглядае сапраўды занепакоенай. — "Падобна, вас вось-вось званітуе... Можа, вам нешта прынесці?"

links.title: Endurance: "She's right. Something wants to com..."
links.english: She's right. Something wants to come out -- through your mouth. But you can keep it down because your body does not control you.
links.polish: Ma rację. Coś chce wyjść ci przez usta. Ale jesteś w stanie to powstrzymać, bo to ty kontrolujesz swoje ciało, a nie odwrotnie.
links.belarusian: Яна мае рацыю. Нешта хоча вырвацца з цябе навонкі — праз рот. Але ты ў стане гэта стрымаць, бо гэта ты кантралюеш сваё цела, а не наадварот.

links.title: You: ""I'm fine. Answer the question.""
links.english: "I'm fine. Answer the question."
links.polish: „Nic mi nie jest. Odpowiedz na pytanie”.
links.belarusian: "Я ў парадку. Адказвайце на пытанне."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Sir, you've been here for three da..."
links.english: "Sir, you've been here for three days. On *official police business*, as you put it."
links.polish: „Jest pan tu od trzech dni. *W sprawach służbowych*, jak sam pan twierdził”.
links.belarusian: "Спадар, вы тут ужо тры дні. *Па службовых справах*, як вы самі сцвярджалі."

links.title: You: ""What kind of business?""
links.english: "What kind of business?"
links.polish: „Co to dokładnie za sprawy?”
links.belarusian: "Па якіх дакладна справах?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Sir..." For a moment it looks like..."
links.english: "Sir..." For a moment it looks like you're going to blow, but you manage to keep it in. "You've been here for three days. On *official police business*, no less."
links.polish: „Proszę pana...” – przez chwilę wydaje ci się, że wyrzucisz z siebie treść żołądkową, ale udaje ci się utrzymać ją w środku. „Jest pan tu od trzech dni. *W sprawach służbowych* bez wątpienia”.
links.belarusian: "Спадару..." — на імгненне табе здаецца, што зараз цябе выверне, але ў цябе атрымліваецца стрымацца. "Вы тут ужо тры дні. *Па службовых справах*, без сумневаў."

links.title: You: ""Don't worry, I'm not going to vomi..."
links.english: "Don't worry, I'm not going to vomit."
links.polish: „Spokojnie, nie będę wymiotował”.
links.belarusian: "Не хвалюйцеся, мяне не будзе ванітаваць".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Okay.""
links.english: "Okay."
links.polish: „Okej”.
links.belarusian: "Добра."

links.title: You: ""I feel wretched. Tell me, how do y..."
links.english: "I feel wretched. Tell me, how do you know I'm with the police?"
links.polish: „Czuję się paskudnie. Powiedz, skąd wiesz, że jestem z policji?”
links.belarusian: "Пачуваюся паскудна. Скажыце, як вы даведаліся, што я з паліцыі?"

links.title: You: ""It's a small wonder I'm able to ev..."
links.english: "It's a small wonder I'm able to even formulate this very thought. But I'll be fine. How did you know I was a cop?"
links.polish: „To aż dziwne, że jestem w ogóle w stanie sformułować tę myśl. Ale nic mi nie będzie. Skąd wiedziałaś, że jestem gliną?”
links.belarusian: "Гэта дзіва, што я наогул здольны сфармуляваць гэтую думку. Але са мной усё будзе ў парадку. Як вы даведаліся, што я коп?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She's right. Something wants to com..."
links.english: She's right. Something wants to come out through your mouth, right in front of her, right here... It makes you put your hand on your stomach and swallow.
links.polish: Nie myli się. Coś chce wydostać się z twoich ust w jej obecności, tu i teraz... To sprawia, że kładziesz dłoń na żołądku i przełykasz świadomie.
links.belarusian: Яна мае рацыю. Нешта хоча вырвацца з цябе навонкі праз рот, проста перад ёй, проста цяпер... Гэта прымушае цябе пакласці руку на жывот і зглытнуць.

links.title: You: "Turn your bloated face away from he..."
links.english: Turn your bloated face away from her beauty and just keep on walking. [Leave.]
links.polish: Odwróć swoją napuchniętą twarz od jej piękna i po prostu idź dalej. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: Адвярнуць свой азызлы твар ад яе прыгажосці і проста ісці далей. [Адысці.]

dialogueTree.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "The young woman raises a cigarette..."
dialogueTree.english: The young woman raises a cigarette to her lips.
dialogueTree.polish: Młoda kobieta podnosi papieros do ust.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Маладая жанчына падносіць цыгарэту да вуснаў.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Her eyes are brown and her face is..."
links.english: Her eyes are brown and her face is speckled with birthmarks. She can't be more than 28.
links.polish: Ma brązowe oczy i pokrytą znamionami twarz. Nie może mieć więcej niż 28 lat.
links.belarusian: У яе карыя вочы і ўсыпаны радзімкамі твар. Яна не можа быць старэйшая за 28 гадоў.

links.title: Conceptualization: "A silver jumpsuit falls off her lik..."
links.english: A silver jumpsuit falls off her like scale armour, sparkling. This is the sparkle of too many nights out on the city.
links.polish: Błyszczący, srebrny kombinezon wygląda na niej jak łuskowa zbroja. Roztacza blask zbyt wielu spędzonych na mieście nocy.
links.belarusian: Срэбны камбінезон зіхціць на ёй, як лускаватая браня. Гэта ззянне празмернай колькасці праведзеных у горадзе начэй.
